turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Night Across the Street.
turn.1: What does it mean when Ben moves his hands across the street?
turn.2: His coworker points out that he has never done this before, but with the previous sequence that we have seen, we can assume that he is moving his hands this way because he is reenacting his conversation that he just had with Jean Giono.
turn.3: What else is significant about this?
turn.4: This could mean that he is in another dimension of time until he is alerted by his boss.
turn.5: Is there anything else I should know about this episode?
turn.6: We later learn in this sequence that Don Celso is only days away from retirement and that he is going to have a retirement party the next day.
turn.7: Is that all of the information?
turn.8: We are followed up by Don Celso in his third dimension, as a young boy who calls himself Rhododendron Celso(Santiago Figueroa) or Rodo for short.
turn.9: Is there anything else he does as a child?
turn.10: In this sequence he is interacting with famous pirate, Long John Silver (Pedro Villagara) or Captain as he asks to be called.
turn.11: Does he have any other interactions with Silver?
turn.12: In this interaction, we see Celso’s perspective on who he believes Long John Silver to be which clearly dates back to several centuries ago.
